sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; import './ResearchPage.css'; const ResearchPage = () => { const projects = [ { title: "Stochastic Volatility Model Implementation", description: "Developed and implemented the Heston stochastic volatility model for option pricing with Monte Carlo simulation and finite difference methods.", technologies: ["Python", "NumPy", "QuantLib", "Monte Carlo"], mathematics: "dS_t = μS_t dt + √V_t S_t dW₁_t, dV_t = κ(θ - V_t)dt + σ√V_t dW₂_t" }, { title: "Portfolio Optimization with Machine Learning", description: "Applied reinforcement learning algorithms to dynamic portfolio allocation, incorporating transaction costs and market impact models.", technologies: ["Python", "TensorFlow", "Pandas", "Reinforcement Learning"], mathematics: "max E[∑ᵢ γⁱ r(sᵢ, aᵢ)] subject to risk constraints" }, { title: "High-Frequency Trading Strategy", description: "Designed and backtested algorithmic trading strategies using statistical arbitrage and market microstructure analysis.", technologies: ["C++", "Python", "Bloomberg API", "Statistical Analysis"], mathematics: "P(price_t+1 | X_t) where X_t includes order book features" }, { title: "Credit Risk Modeling", description: "Implemented structural and reduced-form credit risk models for corporate bond pricing and default probability estimation.", technologies: ["R", "MATLAB", "Statistical Modeling", "Time Series"], mathematics: "P(τ > t) = exp(-∫₀ᵗ λ(s)ds) where λ(t) is hazard rate" } ]; return (

λ Quantitative Research

Mathematical Finance & Computational Projects

Featured Projects

{projects.map((project, index) => (

{project.title}

{project.description}

Mathematical Foundation:

{project.mathematics}

Technologies:

{project.technologies.map((tech, techIndex) => ( {tech} ))}
))}

Research Areas

∂

Derivatives Pricing

Advanced mathematical models for exotic options, structured products, and volatility derivatives using PDE methods and Monte Carlo simulation.

∫

Risk Management

Quantitative risk models including VaR, CVaR, and stress testing frameworks for portfolio and institutional risk assessment.

Σ

Algorithmic Trading

Statistical arbitrage, market making, and execution algorithms with focus on latency optimization and market impact modeling.

∇

Machine Learning Finance

Application of deep learning, reinforcement learning, and natural language processing to financial prediction and automation.

Academic Contributions

"Computational Methods in Stochastic Volatility Modeling"

Stanford Mathematical Finance Seminar, 2024

Presented novel numerical techniques for calibrating the Heston model with improved convergence properties and computational efficiency.

"Machine Learning Applications in Portfolio Optimization"

Quantitative Finance Research Group, 2023

Demonstrated superior risk-adjusted returns using reinforcement learning compared to traditional mean-variance optimization.

); }; export default ResearchPage;
